description: Context.IO is a modern, scalable email API that brings IMAP into the 21st century.Enrich your application with email data: contacts, attachments, receipts, reservations, travel information, and much more.Context.IO can connect to any IMAP enabled email including Gmail, Google Apps, Outlook, Yahoo, AOL, and more.Get near real-time notifications for new and sent messages via webhooks. We offer rich filtering features to ensure you only get the data you need.Context.IO is free to use for most cases, but we offer flexible pricing tiers for companies of any size.

events.name: webhookEvent
events.description: The Todoist Webhooks API allows applications to receive real-time notification (in the form of HTTP POST payload) on the subscribed user events. Notice that once you have a webhook setup, you will start receiving webhook events from all your app users immediately.
steps: Use createUserLevelWebhook or createApplicationLevelWebhook endpoints and set callback to __WEBHOOK_URL__ for your account.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

blocks.name: createAccount
blocks.description: You can create an account with no source by only passing in the email param. If you choose this option, you will need to add a source later.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: email
args.info: The primary email address used to receive emails in this account.

args.name: firstName
args.info: First name of the account holder.

args.name: lastName
args.info: Last name of the account holder.

args.name: syncAllFolders
args.info: By default, we filter out some folders like ‘Deleted Items’ and 'Drafts’. Set this parameter to `off` to turn off this filtering and show every single folder.

args.name: expungeOnDeletedFlag
args.info: By default, we don’t filter out messages flagged as deleted. Set this parameter to `on` to turn on this filtering.

args.name: callbackUrl
args.info: If specified, we’ll make a POST request to this URL when the initial sync is completed.

args.name: statusCallbackUrl
args.info: If specified, we’ll make a POST request to this URL if the connection status of the source changes.

blocks.name: createSources
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to add a source to an existing account. An account id is required to add a source to an existing account.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: email
args.info: The primary email address used to receive emails in this account.

args.name: username
args.info: The username used to authenticate an IMAP connection. On some servers, this is the same thing as the primary email address.

args.name: server
args.info: Name of IP of the IMAP server, eg. imap.gmail.com.

args.name: useSsl
args.info: Set to 1 if you want SSL encryption to be used when opening connections to the IMAP server. Any other value will be considered as “do not use SSL”.

args.name: port
args.info: Port number to connect to on the server. For most servers, SSL is 993, and unencrypted (non-SSL) is 143.

args.name: type
args.info: Currently, the only supported type is IMAP.

args.name: originIp
args.info: IP address of the end user requesting the account to be created

args.name: syncAllFolders
args.info: By default, we filter out some folders like ‘Deleted Items’ and 'Drafts’. Set this parameter to `off` to turn off this filtering and show every single folder.

args.name: expungeOnDeletedFlag
args.info: By default, we don’t filter out messages flagged as deleted. Set this parameter to `on` to turn on this filtering.

args.name: password
args.info: Password for this source. Required when creating a source and account in a single call. Ignored if any of the provider_* parameters are set below.

args.name: providerRefreshToken
args.info: An OAuth2 refresh token obtained from the IMAP account provider to authenticate this email account. Required if using oauth when creating a source and account in a single call.

args.name: providerConsumerKey
args.info: The OAuth2 Client ID used to obtain the the refresh token for the above account. Required if using oauth when creating a source and account in a single call.

args.name: callbackUrl
args.info: If specified, we’ll make a POST request to this URL when the initial sync is completed.

args.name: statusCallbackUrl
args.info: If specified, we’ll make a POST request to this URL if the connection status of the source changes.

args.name: rawFileList
args.info: By default, we filter out files like signature images or those winmail.dat files form the files list. Set this parameter to `off` to turn off this filtering and show every single file attachments.

blocks.name: deleteAccount
blocks.description: If you need to delete an account, you can do so by using this endpoint. This will delete the account and all sources associated with it.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

blocks.name: deleteSource
blocks.description: If you wish to only delete a certain source from the account, but not delete the account itself.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: label
args.info: The label property of the source instance. You can use 0 as an alias for the first source of an account.

blocks.name: connectTokensWizard
blocks.description: Connect tokens are a feature we provide to facilitate account creation.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: callbackUrl
args.info: When the user’s mailbox is connected to your API key, the browser will call this url (GET). This call will have a parameter called contextio_token indicating the connect_token related to this callback. You can then do a get on this connect_token to obtain details about the account and source created through that token and save that account id in your own user data.

args.name: email
args.info: The email address of the account to be added. If specified, the first step of the connect UI where users are prompted for their email address, first name and last name is skipped.

args.name: firstName
args.info: First name of the account holder.

args.name: lastName
args.info: Last name of the account holder.

args.name: sourceCallbackUrl
args.info: If specified, we’ll make a POST request to this URL when the initial sync is completed.

args.name: sourceExpungeOnDeletedFlag
args.info: By default, we don’t filter out messages flagged as deleted. Set this parameter to `on` to turn on this filtering.

args.name: sourceSyncAllFolders
args.info: By default, we filter out some folders like ‘Deleted Items’ and 'Drafts’. Set this parameter to `off` to turn off this filtering and show every single folder.

args.name: sourceSyncFolders
args.info: By default, we filter out some folders like 'Deleted Items’ and 'Drafts’. Set this parameter to `All`,`Trash` to show the 'Deleted Items’ folder.

args.name: sourceRawFileList
args.info: By default, we filter out files like signature images or those winmail.dat files form the files list. Set this parameter to 1 to turn off this filtering and show every single file attachments.

args.name: statusCallbackUrl
args.info: If specified, we’ll make a POST request to this URL if the connection status of the source changes.

blocks.name: getConnectTokenDetails
blocks.description: Getting data about connect token will tell you:If the connect token was used;It not used, you will see when it will expire;If the connect token was used, you will see data about which source was added with the connect token;

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: token
args.info: The unique random token used to add a second source to an existing account.

blocks.name: getAllConnectTokensForAccount
blocks.description: Use this call to list all connect tokens associated with an account (used or unused).

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

blocks.name: getAllConnectTokensForSource
blocks.description: Use this call to list all connect tokens associated with a source (used or unused).

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: label
args.info: The label property of the source instance.

blocks.name: getAccountDetails
blocks.description: Getting details at the account level will give you:Account creation date;List all sources linked to the account;Number of messages currently in the mailbox;

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

blocks.name: getAllSources
blocks.description: If the account has more than once source, this endpoint will list all sources associated with the account. Optional parameters will allow you to filter by source status.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: status
args.info: Only return sources whose status is of a specific value.

args.name: statusOk
args.info: Set to `false` to get sources that are not working correctly. Set to `true` to get those that are.

blocks.name: getSourceDetail
blocks.description: The name of a source in Context.IO is called a “label”. The label will be included in the response when you get account or source details and looks something like `email::provider`.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: label
args.info: The label property of the source instance.

blocks.name: getAllMessages
blocks.description: List all messages in the account (including all sources associated with the account). This call hits our cache of metadata for the account, so this call should be faster than hitting IMAP.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: subject
args.info: Get messages whose subject matches this search string. To use regular expressions instead of simple string matching, make sure the string starts and ends with /.

args.name: emails
args.info: Email address(es) or top level domain of the contact for whom you want the latest messages exchanged with. By “exchanged with contact X” we mean any email received from contact X, sent to contact X or sent by anyone to both contact X and the source owner. This accepts a single address or a comma separated list.

args.name: to
args.info: Email address of a contact messages have been sent to.

args.name: from
args.info: Email address of a contact messages have been received from.

args.name: emailOfContactCC
args.info: Email address of a contact CC'ed on the messages.

args.name: emailOfContactBCC
args.info: Email address of a contact BCC'ed on the messages.

args.name: folder
args.info: Filter messages by the folder (or Gmail label).See more in readme.

args.name: source
args.info: Filter messages by the account source label.

args.name: fileName
args.info: Search for files based on their name. You can filter names using typical shell wildcards such as *, ? and [] or regular expressions by enclosing the search expression in a leading / and trailing /. For example, *.pdf would give you all PDF files while /.jpe?g$/ would return all files whose name ends with .jpg or .jpeg

args.name: fileSizeMin
args.info: Search for files based on their size (in bytes).

args.name: fileSizeMax
args.info: Search for files based on their size (in bytes).

args.name: dateBefore
args.info: Only include messages before a given timestamp. The value this filter is applied to is the Date: header of the message which refers to the time the message is sent from the origin.

args.name: dateAfter
args.info: Only include messages after a given timestamp. The value this filter is applied to is the Date: header of the message which refers to the time the message is sent from the origin.

args.name: indexedBefore
args.info: Only include messages indexed before a given timestamp. This is not the same as the date of the email, it is the time Context.IO indexed this message.

args.name: indexedAfter
args.info: Only include messages indexed after a given timestamp. This is not the same as the date of the email, it is the time Context.IO indexed this message.

args.name: includeThreadSize
args.info: Set to `true` to include thread size in the result.

args.name: includeBody
args.info: Set to `true` to include message bodies in the result. Since message bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

args.name: includeHeaders
args.info: Can be set to `false` (default), `true` or raw. If set to `true`, complete message headers, parsed into an array, are included in the results. If set to raw, the headers are also included but as a raw unparsed string. Since full original headers bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

args.name: includeFlags
args.info: Set to `true` to include thread size in the result.

args.name: bodyType
args.info: Used when includeBody is set to get only body parts of a given MIME-type (for example text/html).

args.name: includeSource
args.info: Set to 1 to include message sources in the result. Since message sources must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: The sort order of the returned results.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

args.name: offset
args.info: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

blocks.name: getFolderMessages
blocks.description: Listing messages from a specific folder.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: sourceLabel
args.info: The label property of the source instance. You can use 0 as an alias for the first source of an account.

args.name: folder
args.info: The full folder path using / as the path hierarchy delimiter.

args.name: includeThreadSize
args.info: Set to `true` to include thread size in the result.

args.name: includeBody
args.info: Set to `true` to include message bodies in the result. Since message bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

args.name: includeHeaders
args.info: Can be set to `false` (default), `true` or raw. If set to `true`, complete message headers, parsed into an array, are included in the results. If set to raw, the headers are also included but as a raw unparsed string. Since full original headers bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

args.name: includeFlags
args.info: Set to `true` to include thread size in the result.

args.name: bodyType
args.info: Used when includeBody is set to get only body parts of a given MIME-type (for example text/html).

args.name: flagSeen
args.info: Message has been read. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

args.name: offset
args.info: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

blocks.name: getMessage
blocks.description: Get an individual message based on a `messageId`. You can use either a `messageId` or `emailMessageId`

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: messageId
args.info: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

args.name: includeThreadSize
args.info: Set to `true` to include thread size in the result.

args.name: includeBody
args.info: Set to `true` to include message bodies in the result. Since message bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

args.name: includeHeaders
args.info: Can be set to `false` (default), `true` or raw. If set to `true`, complete message headers, parsed into an array, are included in the results. If set to raw, the headers are also included but as a raw unparsed string. Since full original headers bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

args.name: includeFlags
args.info: Set to `true` to include thread size in the result.

args.name: bodyType
args.info: Used when includeBody is set to get only body parts of a given MIME-type (for example text/html).

args.name: includeSource
args.info: Set to 1 to include message sources in the result. Since message sources must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

blocks.name: getMessageBody
blocks.description: The name of a source in Context.IO is called a “label”. The label will be included in the response when you get account or source details and looks something like `email::provider`.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: messageId
args.info: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

args.name: type
args.info: Many emails are sent with both rich text and plain text versions in the message body and by default, the response of this call will include both.

blocks.name: getMessageFlags
blocks.description: This call lists all flags currently applied to this message.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: messageId
args.info: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

blocks.name: updateMessageFlags
blocks.description: This call will allow you to set or unset flags for a specific message.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: messageId
args.info: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

args.name: seen
args.info: Message has been read. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

args.name: answered
args.info: Message has been answered. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

args.name: flagged
args.info: Message is “flagged” for urgent/special attention. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

args.name: deleted
args.info: Message is `deleted` for later removal. An alternative way of deleting messages is to move it to the Trash folder. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

args.name: draft
args.info: Message has not completed composition (marked as a draft). Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

blocks.name: getMessageFolders
blocks.description: This call returns the folder(s) a message appears in.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: messageId
args.info: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

blocks.name: getMessageHeaders
blocks.description: This call returns only the headers for this message. We send a parsed response by default, but you can also choose to get the raw RFC 822 headers.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: messageId
args.info: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

args.name: raw
args.info: By default, this returns messages headers parsed into an array. Set this parameter to `unparsed` to get raw unparsed headers.

blocks.name: getMessageRawSource
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the raw RFC 822 source message.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: messageId
args.info: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

blocks.name: getMessageThread
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the the entire thread of messages a message is in that Context.IO has access to. Replies in the thread from accounts not in Context.Io would not appear here.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: messageId
args.info: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

args.name: includeBody
args.info: Set to `true` to include message bodies in the result. Since message bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

args.name: includeHeaders
args.info: Can be set to `false` (default), `true` or raw. If set to `true`, complete message headers, parsed into an array, are included in the results. If set to raw, the headers are also included but as a raw unparsed string. Since full original headers bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

args.name: includeFlags
args.info: Set to `true` to include thread size in the result.

args.name: bodyType
args.info: Used when includeBody is set to get only body parts of a given MIME-type (for example text/html).

args.name: includeSource
args.info: Set to 1 to include message sources in the result. Since message sources must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: The sort order of the returned results.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

args.name: offset
args.info: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

blocks.name: updateMessage
blocks.description: This call allows you to copy or move a message between folders, or also change the message’s flags all at once. If there are more than one source on the account, you can use this call to copy/move the message between these sources.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: messageId
args.info: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

args.name: folderToCopied
args.info: The folder within dst_source the message should be copied to.

args.name: sourceLabel
args.info: Label of the source you want the message copied to. This field is required if you’re moving a message that already exists in one source of the account to another source of that account.If you only want to move the message to a different folder within the same source, folderToCopied is sufficient.

args.name: move
args.info: By default, this calls copies the original message in the destination. Set this parameter to `true` to move instead of copy.

args.name: flagSeen
args.info: Message has been read. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

args.name: flagAnswered
args.info: Message has been answered. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

args.name: flagDeleted
args.info: Message is `deleted` for later removal. An alternative way of deleting messages is to move it to the Trash folder. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

args.name: flagDraft
args.info: Message has not completed composition (marked as a draft). Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

blocks.name: moveMessage
blocks.description: This call allows you to move a message between folders, or also change the message’s flags all at once. If there are more than one source on the account, you can use this call to copy/move the message between these sources.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: messageId
args.info: Unique id of a message. This can be the `message_id` or `emailMessageId` property of the message. The `gmailMessageId` (prefixed with gm-) can also be used.

args.name: folderToCopied
args.info: The folder within dst_source the message should be copied to.

args.name: sourceLabel
args.info: Label of the source you want the message copied to. This field is required if you’re moving a message that already exists in one source of the account to another source of that account.If you only want to move the message to a different folder within the same source, folderToCopied is sufficient.

args.name: flagSeen
args.info: Message has been read. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

args.name: flagAnswered
args.info: Message has been answered. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

args.name: flagDeleted
args.info: Message is `deleted` for later removal. An alternative way of deleting messages is to move it to the Trash folder. Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

args.name: flagDraft
args.info: Message has not completed composition (marked as a draft). Set this parameter to `set` to set the flag, `unset` to unset it.

blocks.name: getAllSourceFolders
blocks.description: List folders for a given source (email address).

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: sourceLabel
args.info: The label property of the source instance. You can use 0 as an alias for the first source of an account.

args.name: includeExtendedCounts
args.info: Set to `include` to include extended counts in the result (for now, the only extended count supported is number of unseen messages). Since counts must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

args.name: noCache
args.info: Set to `true` to fetch the folder list directly from the IMAP server. Since data must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

blocks.name: getSourceFolder
blocks.description: Get information about a given folder such as number of messages, number of unseen messages, and other attributes.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: sourceLabel
args.info: The label property of the source instance. You can use 0 as an alias for the first source of an account.

args.name: folder
args.info: The full folder path using / as the path hierarchy delimiter.

args.name: delimiter
args.info: If / isn’t fancy enough as a hierarchy delimiter when specifying the folder you want to obtain, you’re free to use what you want, just make sure you set this delim parameter to tell us what you’re using.

args.name: includeExtendedCounts
args.info: Set to `include` to include extended counts in the result (for now, the only extended count supported is number of unseen messages). Since counts must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

blocks.name: createUserLevelWebhook
blocks.description: Webhooks set at the user level are applicable only to the user on which the webhook is set. User level webhooks should be used for cases when you will be monitoring things that are very specific to each individual user.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: callbackUrl
args.info: A valid URL Context.IO calls when a matching message is found. The callback URL is called with an HTTP POST with message information in request body

args.name: failureNotifyUrl
args.info: (DEPRECATED) A valid URL Context.IO calls if the WebHooks fails and will no longer be active. That may happen if, for example, the server becomes unreachable or if it closes an IDLE connection and we can’t re-establish it.

args.name: filterTo
args.info: Check for new messages received to a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

args.name: filterFrom
args.info: Check for new messages received from a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

args.name: filterEmailList
args.info: Check for new messages received from a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

args.name: filterSubject
args.info: Check for new messages with a subject matching a given string or regular expression.

args.name: filterThread
args.info: Check for new messages in a given thread. Value can be a gmail_thread_id or the email_message_id of an existing message currently in the thread.

args.name: filterFileName
args.info: Check for new messages where a file whose name matches the given string is attached.

args.name: filterFolderAdded
args.info: Check for messages filed in a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label applied to a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

args.name: filterFolderRemoved
args.info: Check for messages removed from a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label removed from a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

args.name: filterToDomains
args.info: Check for new messages sent to a given domain. Also accepts a comma delimited list of domains.

args.name: filterFolderRemoved
args.info: Check for messages removed from a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label removed from a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

args.name: includeBody
args.info: Set to `true` to include message bodies in the result. Since message bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

args.name: bodyType
args.info: Required to be set when “include_body” is set to get only body parts of a given MIME-type

args.name: includeHeader
args.info: Set to `true` or raw to include message headers in the result.

args.name: receiveAllChanges
args.info: By default, we only send a webhook notification on the first event of a message (i.e. when a message is received or sent). Subsequent changes of a specific message do not trigger a webhook (i.e. if a message changes folders). When this parameter is set to `true`, we will send all events related to a message.

args.name: receiveDrafts
args.info: Set to `true`, you will receive messages that are flagged as 'Drafts' in Gmail

blocks.name: getAllUserWebhooks
blocks.description: List all webhooks set on a specific user.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

blocks.name: getUserWebhookDetail
blocks.description: Get information about a single user level webhook, such whether it is active and what filters are set on the webhook.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: webhookId
args.info: Unique id of a user level webhook.

blocks.name: createApplicationLevelWebhook
blocks.description: Webhooks set at the application level apply to all users in your userbase.Application level webhooks encourage a more DRY approach to using the Context.IO API.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: callbackUrl
args.info: A valid URL Context.IO calls when a matching message is found. The callback URL is called with an HTTP POST with message information in request body

args.name: failureNotifyUrl
args.info: (DEPRECATED) A valid URL Context.IO calls if the WebHooks fails and will no longer be active. That may happen if, for example, the server becomes unreachable or if it closes an IDLE connection and we can’t re-establish it.

args.name: active
args.info: By default, webhooks are set to active when first created. Set to 'false' to temporarily stop receiving callbacks for this webhook. Set to `true` again to resume.

args.name: filterTo
args.info: Check for new messages received to a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

args.name: filterFrom
args.info: Check for new messages received from a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

args.name: filterEmailList
args.info: Check for new messages received from a given name or email address. Also accepts a comma delimited list of email addresses.

args.name: filterSubject
args.info: Check for new messages with a subject matching a given string or regular expression.

args.name: filterThread
args.info: Check for new messages in a given thread. Value can be a gmail_thread_id or the email_message_id of an existing message currently in the thread.

args.name: filterFileName
args.info: Check for new messages where a file whose name matches the given string is attached.

args.name: filterFolderAdded
args.info: Check for messages filed in a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label applied to a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

args.name: filterFolderRemoved
args.info: Check for messages removed from a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label removed from a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

args.name: filterToDomains
args.info: Check for new messages sent to a given domain. Also accepts a comma delimited list of domains.

args.name: filterFolderRemoved
args.info: Check for messages removed from a given folder. On Gmail, this is equivalent to having a label removed from a message. The value should be the complete name (including parents if applicable) of the folder you want to track.

args.name: includeBody
args.info: Set to `true` to include message bodies in the result. Since message bodies must be retrieved from the IMAP server, expect a performance hit when setting this parameter.

args.name: bodyType
args.info: Required to be set when “include_body” is set to get only body parts of a given MIME-type

args.name: includeHeader
args.info: Set to `true` or raw to include message headers in the result.

args.name: receiveAllChanges
args.info: By default, we only send a webhook notification on the first event of a message (i.e. when a message is received or sent). Subsequent changes of a specific message do not trigger a webhook (i.e. if a message changes folders). When this parameter is set to `true`, we will send all events related to a message.

args.name: receiveDrafts
args.info: Set to `true`, you will receive messages that are flagged as `Drafts` in Gmail

args.name: receiveHistorical
args.info: Set to `true`, we will perform a backscan of an account when a new account is added and send messages from new to old to your callback URL.

blocks.name: getAllContacts
blocks.description: There are several ways you can interact with a user’s contacts.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: search
args.info: String identifying the name or the email address of the contact(s) you are looking for.

args.name: activeBefore
args.info: Only include contacts included in at least one email dated before a given time.

args.name: activeAfter
args.info: Only include contacts included in at least one email dated after a given time.

args.name: sortBy
args.info: The field by which to sort the returned results.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: The sort order of the returned results.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

args.name: offset
args.info: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

blocks.name: getContactDetails
blocks.description: Get information about a given contact such as when a message was last sent or last received, as well as how many messages have been sent to this contact, or received from this contact.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: email
args.info: Email address of a contact

blocks.name: getFilesSharedWithContact
blocks.description: List files shared with a specific contact(s).

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: email
args.info: Email address of a contact

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

args.name: offset
args.info: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

blocks.name: getListMessagesExchange
blocks.description: Get a list of email messages exchanged with one or more email addresses. This includes messages sent by a contact, received from a contact, or where both the contact and mailbox owner are included in the list of recipients.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: email
args.info: Email address of a contact.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

args.name: offset
args.info: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

blocks.name: getListThreadsIncludeContact
blocks.description: List threads where a specific contact(s) is present in the recipient list.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: email
args.info: Email address of a contact.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

args.name: offset
args.info: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

blocks.name: getAllFiles
blocks.description: The name of a source in Context.IO is called a “label”. The label will be included in the response when you get account or source details and looks something like `email::provider`.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: fileName
args.info: Search for files based on their name. You can filter names using typical shell wildcards such as *, ? and [] or regular expressions by enclosing the search expression in a leading / and trailing /. For example, *.pdf would give you all PDF files while /.jpe?g$/ would return all files whose name ends with .jpg or .jpeg

args.name: fileSizeMin
args.info: Search for files based on their size (in bytes).

args.name: fileSizeMax
args.info: Search for files based on their size (in bytes).

args.name: email
args.info: Email address of the contact for whom you want the latest files in which this email address was listed as a recipient.

args.name: to
args.info: Email address of a contact messages have been sent to.

args.name: from
args.info: Email address of a contact messages have been received from.

args.name: emailOfContactCC
args.info: Email address of a contact CC'ed on the messages.

args.name: emailOfContactBCC
args.info: Email address of a contact BCC'ed on the messages.

args.name: dateBefore
args.info: Only include messages before a given timestamp. The value this filter is applied to is the Date: header of the message which refers to the time the message is sent from the origin.

args.name: dateAfter
args.info: Only include messages after a given timestamp. The value this filter is applied to is the Date: header of the message which refers to the time the message is sent from the origin.

args.name: indexedBefore
args.info: Only include messages indexed before a given timestamp. This is not the same as the date of the email, it is the time Context.IO indexed this message.

args.name: indexedAfter
args.info: Only include messages indexed after a given timestamp. This is not the same as the date of the email, it is the time Context.IO indexed this message.

args.name: source
args.info: Filter messages by the account source label.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: The sort order of the returned results.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum limit is 100. The default if no limit is provided is 25.

args.name: offset
args.info: Start the list at this offset (zero-based).

blocks.name: getFileDetails
blocks.description: Get details about a specific file.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: fileId
args.info: Unique id of a file.

blocks.name: downloadFilesContents
blocks.description: There are a couple ways you can download the file itself from the API.Get the file itself in the response;Get an AWS link you can use to download the file;

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: accountId
args.info: Unique id of an account.

args.name: fileId
args.info: Unique id of a file.

args.name: asLink
args.info: Set to `true`, get an AWS link you can use to download the file.

blocks.name: discoveringImapSettings
blocks.description: If you prefer to handle your own authentication and add accounts or sources manually, you may want to check for IMAP configuration settings to add users. The Discovery endpoint returns known IMAP configuration settings given an email address.

args.name: consumerKey
args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: sourceType
args.info: The type of source you want to discover settings for.

args.name: email
args.info: An email address you want to discover IMAP settings for.

blocks.name: getAllOauthProviders
blocks.description: List all oauth providers linked to your Context.IO API key.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.info: The consumer key from your account.

args.name: consumerSecret
args.info: The consumer secret from your account.

args.name: type
args.info: Identification of the OAuth2 provider.

args.name: providerConsumerKey
args.info: The OAuth2 Client ID.

args.name: providerConsumerSecret
args.info: The OAuth2 Client Secret

blocks.name: getOauthProviderDetails
blocks.description: Get information about an oauth provider.

args.name: consumerSecret

args.name: providerConsumerKey

args.name: providerConsumerKey
